evidence: These false structures are what we call image artifacts.
We’ll discuss CT image quality considerations next, which include how artifacts impact the overall image quality.
Sometimes, artifacts show up as streaks or stripes in the image, but obviously, there are no stripes inside the human body.
If there’s no real structure present, what you see might just be noise.
